properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 1 at 3:37PM HST until March 2 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu HI
properties.description:
...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST MONDAY
FOR SUMMITS AND UPPER ELEVATIONS OF MAUI AND THE BIG ISLAND...

.An upper low just east of the state is bringing very cold
temperatures to the higher elevations of Maui and the Big Island,
leading to wintry weather above 9000 feet. The main threat will be
freezing rain leading to ice covered roadways, especially during
the nighttime and early morning hours. Some snow showers are
expected over the Big Island summits.

* WHAT...Freezing rain expected. Some snow expected on the Big
Island summits. Additional snow accumulations of up to 3 inches.

* WHERE...Haleakala Summit and Big Island Summits.

* WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, leading to road
closures. Summit roadways will likely become dangerously
slippery due to patches of ice mixed with areas of snow, with
reduced visibility at times.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Weather Advisory means that periods of snow, sleet, or
freezing rain will cause travel difficulties. Postpone travel
plans to the summits until weather conditions improve, as warmer
and drier conditions are expected on Monday.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST MONDAY
